segment.source: The Windows 8.1 upgrade retains the majority of OEM customizations, including OEM branding, apps, help and support information, drivers, and OEM store listings.
segment.target: The Windows 8.1 upgrade retains the majority of OEM customizations, including OEM branding, apps, help and support information, drivers, and OEM store listings.

segment.source: Some OEM solutions, including a custom Help and Support experience or custom recovery solution might not persist through the upgrade.
segment.target: Some OEM solutions, including a custom Help and Support experience or custom recovery solution might not persist through the upgrade.

segment.source: To mitigate any potential problems for your customers, test the end-to-end upgrade experience.
segment.target: To mitigate any potential problems for your customers, test the end-to-end upgrade experience.

segment.source: The Windows 8.1 can be installed from the Windows Store or from media.
segment.target: The Windows 8.1 can be installed from the Windows Store or from media.

segment.source: Full Upgrade preserves apps, user data, user accounts, and PC settings.
segment.target: Full Upgrade preserves apps, user data, user accounts, and PC settings.

segment.source: Data Only preserves user accounts and data, but doesn’t preserve desktop application installs or OS settings.
segment.target: Data Only preserves user accounts and data, but doesn’t preserve desktop application installs or OS settings.

segment.source: Drivers that are critical for installation (storage and networking drivers) are migrated to the new installation.
segment.target: Drivers that are critical for installation (storage and networking drivers) are migrated to the new installation.

segment.source: Clean install doesn’t save any data or Windows configurations.
segment.target: Clean install doesn’t save any data or Windows configurations.

segment.source: All personal files, and Windows files and directories, are moved to a Windows.old folder, and can be accessed after Windows Setup is complete.
segment.target: All personal files, and Windows files and directories, are moved to a Windows.old folder, and can be accessed after Windows Setup is complete.

segment.source: Personal files will remain in Windows.old.
segment.target: Personal files will remain in Windows.old.

segment.source: After a period of time, Windows files from the previous installation are removed.
segment.target: After a period of time, Windows files from the previous installation are removed.

segment.source: The supported options for upgrade are:
segment.target: The supported options for upgrade are:

segment.source: Windows 8.1 upgrade installations from Windows Vista and Windows XP aren’t supported.
segment.target: Windows 8.1 upgrade installations from Windows Vista and Windows XP aren’t supported.

segment.source: Rollback to the previous installation occurs when the Windows upgrade fails.
segment.target: Rollback to the previous installation occurs when the Windows upgrade fails.

segment.source: Troubleshoot issues by looking at the log files (Drive$Windows.~BTsourcesPanther and sourcesRollback, where Drive is the root of the drive where Windows is installed).
segment.target: Troubleshoot issues by looking at the log files (Drive$Windows.~BTsourcesPanther and sourcesRollback, where Drive is the root of the drive where Windows is installed).

segment.source: The Push-Button Reset image will no longer be available on Windows RT devices if a system rollback occurs.
segment.target: The Push-Button Reset image will no longer be available on Windows RT devices if a system rollback occurs.

segment.source: Windows 8.1 can be installed on PCs with limited disk space.
segment.target: Windows 8.1 can be installed on PCs with limited disk space.

segment.source: The Windows upgrade process compresses the previous Windows installation and deletes large cache files.
segment.target: The Windows upgrade process compresses the previous Windows installation and deletes large cache files.

segment.source: A Windows 8.1 version of Windows RE is installed so that the operating system can be repaired.
segment.target: A Windows 8.1 version of Windows RE is installed so that the operating system can be repaired.

segment.source: During the upgrade, boot critical and input device drivers are added to the new Windows RE image.
segment.target: During the upgrade, boot critical and input device drivers are added to the new Windows RE image.

segment.source: Windows RE is installed in the following ways:
segment.target: Windows RE is installed in the following ways:

segment.source: The existing Windows RE partition is used on Windows RT.
segment.target: The existing Windows RE partition is used on Windows RT.

segment.source: The Windows RE partition is left in place on Windows 8 PCs with an OEM-configured Windows RE partition.
segment.target: The Windows RE partition is left in place on Windows 8 PCs with an OEM-configured Windows RE partition.

segment.source: A new Windows RE partition is created by shrinking the Windows partition.
segment.target: A new Windows RE partition is created by shrinking the Windows partition.

segment.source: The existing Windows RE partition is used on Windows 8 PCs with a generic Windows RE partition.
segment.target: The existing Windows RE partition is used on Windows 8 PCs with a generic Windows RE partition.

segment.source: Any OEM customizations to the existing Windows RE image aren’t migrated to the new Windows RE image.
segment.target: Any OEM customizations to the existing Windows RE image aren’t migrated to the new Windows RE image.

segment.source: Recovery Image for Push Button Reset
segment.target: Recovery Image for Push Button Reset

segment.source: The Push Button Reset image is updated based on the following implementation:
segment.target: The Push Button Reset image is updated based on the following implementation:

segment.source: Before upgrade After upgrade Platform Local recovery image availability
segment.target: Before upgrade After upgrade Platform Local recovery image availability

segment.source: Local recovery image is not available
segment.target: Local recovery image is not available

segment.source: Local recovery image is not available
segment.target: Local recovery image is not available

segment.source: On Windows RT PCs with an existing recovery image, the image will be replaced by a Windows 8.1 recovery image.
segment.target: On Windows RT PCs with an existing recovery image, the image will be replaced by a Windows 8.1 recovery image.

segment.source: The following customizations are migrated to the Windows 8.1 recovery image, including:
segment.target: The following customizations are migrated to the Windows 8.1 recovery image, including:

segment.source: Store customizations and licenses for pre-loaded Windows Store apps
segment.target: Store customizations and licenses for pre-loaded Windows Store apps

segment.source: The recovery image will remain on Windows 8 PCs with an existing recovery image.
segment.target: The recovery image will remain on Windows 8 PCs with an existing recovery image.

segment.source: If the previous operating system doesn’t have an existing recovery image partition, no recovery image or partitions are created.
segment.target: If the previous operating system doesn’t have an existing recovery image partition, no recovery image or partitions are created.

segment.source: In Full upgrade scenarios, the following driver types are migrated:
segment.target: In Full upgrade scenarios, the following driver types are migrated:

segment.source: Third-party drivers installed by an OEM or end-user
segment.target: Third-party drivers installed by an OEM or end-user

segment.source: Storage drivers that are critical to installation are migrated to Windows PE as well as the operating system in all upgrade scenarios.
segment.target: Storage drivers that are critical to installation are migrated to Windows PE as well as the operating system in all upgrade scenarios.

segment.source: The following drivers are not migrated:
segment.target: The following drivers are not migrated:

segment.source: Third-party in-box drivers, such as printer drivers, aren’t migrated because the new operating system typically contains more up-to-date drivers.
segment.target: Third-party in-box drivers, such as printer drivers, aren’t migrated because the new operating system typically contains more up-to-date drivers.

segment.source: Software filter drivers aren’t migrated, with the exception of antivirus filter drivers, or drivers installed by an .inf file.
segment.target: Software filter drivers aren’t migrated, with the exception of antivirus filter drivers, or drivers installed by an .inf file.

segment.source: Network and Wi-Fi drivers are migrated on clean installations and Data Only upgrade scenarios.
segment.target: Network and Wi-Fi drivers are migrated on clean installations and Data Only upgrade scenarios.

segment.source: All migrated drivers are placed in the driver repository and Windows automatically installs drivers during PnP based on the criteria defined in How Windows Ranks Drivers.
segment.target: All migrated drivers are placed in the driver repository and Windows automatically installs drivers during PnP based on the criteria defined in How Windows Ranks Drivers.

segment.source: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs
segment.target: Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs
